title: Superpowers
description: From resurrection to immortality, the amazing things nature can do that we can't.
author: OneZoom

template_data.title: Immortality: the immortal jellyfish
template_data.window_text: The Immortal Jellyfish (Turritopsis dohrnii) is biologically immortal. It can still die, for example if it's eaten! but its chance of death does not increase with old age because it can return to its juvenile state and be reborn.

template_data.title: Eternal youth and resistance to cancer
template_data.window_text: Naked mole rats live together in social colonies with a queen, rather like ants. They have a remarkable resistance to cancer including a gene that prevents uncontroled cell division.
template_data.comment: We need to have comments in the data - this video is a test video I happened to have of the species so uploaded to Vimeo to try it.

template_data.title: Resurrection
template_data.window_text: The dinosaur plant (Selaginella lepidophylla), also known as the resurrection plant has the ability to be revived with water even after a long period of being total dried out and apparently dead.

template_data.title: Regeneration
template_data.window_text: This aquatic salamander has extraorinary powers to regenerate after injury. It can regrow lost limbs and even internal organs.

template_data.title: Noisiness: Song Thrush
template_data.window_text: Not really a superpower, but they are pretty noisy.
